course.name: Exploring Multimedia and Internet Computing
course.description: This course is an introduction to computers and computing tools. It introduces the organization and basic working mechanism of a computer system, including the development of the trend of modern computer system. It covers the fundamentals of computer hardware design and software application development. The course emphasizes the application of the state-of-the-art software tools to solve problems and present solutions via a range of skills related to multimedia and internet computing tools such as internet, e-mail, WWW, webpage design, computer animation, spread sheet charts/figures, presentations with graphics and animations, etc. The course also covers business, accessibility, and relevant security issues in the use of computers and Internet.

以下係我既Data畀大家參考下：
Lecture Quiz（11份，5題每題0.1分）：5.3 /5.5
Lab（7個）：6.5 /7
Exam MC：30 /40（Highest: 35 Mean: 27 Lowest: 7）
Bonus：3%拎晒直接升一個Subgrade
至於Exam第2 Part、Project Proposal、整既App同附上既Video就唔知幾多分（我地係整遊戲既），Exam我係做Word同Excel，基本上應該接近滿分（好簡單，冇咩錯既空間而且一定夠時間）。而我地亦都可以睇得到成班既Proposal同App，比較下我地個App同條片都整得唔錯。

Final grade：A+
可能本身只係拎到A，但因為升一個Subgrade最後A+
同組既Groupmate一個都係A+，另一個B+，大家都升咗一個Subgrade既，Project既分應該都一樣，所以決定性既位應該係Exam。

In the lecture, the professor would teach you different topics like HTML, hardware, software, GIMP, building blocks to write some commands for the moving object.

reviews.comment_teaching: I really like the pronunciation of professor Leung. It is easy to understand. He tries to use different tools and formats to teach us. You can see that he puts his effort to teach, so I would recommend you to go to his class (if you can afford the risk to get an A or a C)
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading consists a lot of stuff... Project, final exam, lecture quiz (doing at home), lab (doing at home/school also is okay). And bonus marks will be given out in the lecture activities, so make sure that you firstly attend the lesson, then perform well with your group mates! Group mates are randomly assigned (not the project one), but luckily, I was paired up with good group mates. I think those bonus marks are also important!

Repeatedly, the project is the core of this course! You have to use your own knowledge to write an app and shoot a video with your group mates. For me, I have 0 knowledge in writing app! So I have to watch some videos to learn, and ask professor Leung & TA to give me some help. Otherwise, it is difficult to finish the app in time. Maybe our project is good and video is funny (professor Leung like funny things), I got an A at the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Wow... workload is not really good for this course... project, exam, lecture quiz (really time-consuming), lab... Actually each part is easy to deal with, but in the long run, you may feel many stuff to catch up. You have to do the quiz and lab every week (for this semester, the lab section is at 6-8pm --> sleepy). You have to write the app eventually. You have to study some technical skills before the exam study break because the exam is not in the exam period. Many small pieces will result a big stuff if you cannot withstand the workload. So... consider if you want to study this course. (If you like writing app, this course will be your very first course to start with! Good luck!)

reviews.title: Actually not very good grade
reviews.comment_content:
The course starts with easy and common sense computer stuff like Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point. However, if you think everything will be so easy in this course, you are about to fall in bad grade.

Things will suddenly get complicated when the course requires you to develop an Android App and learn everything about GIMP. The lectures just teach you very simple however unhelpful knowledge about MIT App inventor so you need to spend much time self-studying about how to use more functions in MIT when you are really trying to develop the App project.

The GIMP is also something SUCKED that seems easy to use but hard to be pro on that. (In Chinese: 易學難精) The lectures just teach you how to use basic function like adjusting brightness or add filter to photos, but the exam needs you to do complicated stuff like background removing and layers editing. If you don't have much time or passion for practice on software using, better not chose this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is a funny guy and his English accent is good and understandable. He was very kind that he was willing to postpone the project submission deadline.
reviews.comment_grading:
This course requires you to do a group project (occupy 40% of the total score, while final just occupies 30%) so you should pray for having good teammates otherwise you won't have any good grade.

I messed up with my final and only got 76% score. (The final contains 20 MC questions for 40% mark and you need to do 3 task out of 4 options by using GIMP/Excel/Word/PPT for 60% mark)

And luckily no freerider in my group project so I got 92.2% of project score. Overall 88% and got B+.

So you need to be prepared that obtaining an A range will be difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
It depends on whether your group have freerider.

Apart from the group project, you need to finish a quiz after self-studying some Power Point slides and hand in the lab work every week (the most torturing part is you need to get full mark on each of them).

AND you need time to familiarize each function of the software they taught if you want to get good mark in final. So I think the workload is really subjective and depends on what grade you want to get.

reviews.author: Weird Guy
reviews.comment_content:
I would not recommend this course for people. One does not learn anything out of this course, and the grading is awful. COMP 1021 or any other programming-related course is way better!
The content was quite simple, describing about the parts of a computer, MS Office, Google Drive, etc. As long as you have used a computer, you will have no problem with the content.
The labs were held once a week and taught about the basics of Google Drive, GIMP, Movie Maker, Word, Excel, and Powerpoint. The materials of the lab were released a day before the session and you could finish it before the lab. You could come to the lab just for attendance. However, the exam required more than the amount learnt in the lab.
There is a group project (group of 3) on designing a website. For this one will have to submit a proposal (a Word Document) on the work distribution, and present the website (a Presentation before the deadline). Remember to choose your group wisely!
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was alright. It was focussed on activities that help understand the concepts taught in the lecture slides. Surprise quizzes would be held, so it is necessary to read the lecture slides before attending the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is Horrible. It is really hard to get a good grade.
There is only one exam, usually around Week 10 of the semester. The exam consists on the things learnt from Word, Excel, Powerpoint, GIMP, Movie Maker, and the lectures.  However, it is super hard. They ask to complete complicated tasks in Word, excel, PowerPoint, and GIMP, and answer 40 MCs on the lecture slides in only two hours.
Despite working hard on the project, the Professor and the TAs do not give good scores.
Attendance to the lectures were necessary, as surprise quizzes would be held on the lecture slides. One could also get bonus marks by doing the tasks in the lectures.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload would depend on the group members of the project. Try to avoid the free-riders.
It is manageable for the lectures and the lab tasks.

You also had to attend labs, which covered softwares like MIT App Inventor, GIMP, Word, Excel and Powerpoint. Only MIT App Inventor and GIMP would be a bit difficult for first time users.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course used blended learning mode, which means you had to watch the lecture videos before the lecture time. During lecture time, the professor would have some recap of the videos and then ask students to break into groups to finish some in-class practice. It is good for those who enjoy self-pace learning, as you can choose the speed of the videos and what time you want to watch the videos.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exam: 30%
Project: 40%
Lecture activities: 40%
Quizzes (done after watching the lecture videos) : 10%
Labs: 10%

Project is the toughest part of the course. Though some marking is provided, some marks are given on subjective basis, so you may need to work harder than expected to get desire score.

Exam is divided into two parts. The first part is mc questions on lecture videos. As handwritten cheat sheet is allowed, this part should be fine for well prepared person. The second part is practical exam, which test your skills to use the softwares taught in labs. As you only need to choose 2 questions out of 4, you can avoid those that are less familiar with.

Also, the prof. will give bonus mark (max. 3 points) for those participate in class or done well in in-class practice.
reviews.comment_workload: For a common core course, this course has much bigger workload, especially for the project part. The project part requires 3 people forming a group and write a program from scratch. So, if you find a bad teammates (e.g. people who doesn't know anything about coding/ people who are demanding), you will have much bigger workload. But out of the project, the workload for other part of the course should be fine.

reviews.title: love hate relationship with kenneth
reviews.comment_content:
A beginner course on basic computer skills and concepts. The labs focus on practical skills that can be quite useful in daily life, like Google Drive, Microsoft Word, Powerpoint, Excel, AppInventor and GIMP (photo editing). The lectures cover topics such as simple game/app programming, internet security concepts,  computer software and hardware, computer graphics and HTML. My most memorable lecture was the one on search engines. Since it is Professor Leung's research interest, he was able to provide great insight into the topic.

Content is mainly factual and not hard to understand. It should be very easy to pick up if you have any background in ICT or technology. I personally think the syllabus is very close to the ICT DSE one, so if you took ICT before it should be pretty easy to handle. Might not learn much new content though.

There's also a group project that requires you to make a mobile app and film a video for it. It's not difficult, but can be time consuming.

Generally a simple and fun course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This course adopts sort of a flip classroom mode, you have to watch pre-recorded lecture videos at home before the lectures and complete very simple online quizzes (5 questions). During the actual lecture, the professor rarely teaches and uses most of the time for lecture activities. Attendance is counted and the activities grant bonuses so it is very important to go to the lectures.

The class is divided into about 10 large groups (pre determined, you can't form your own) and each group works together to complete lecture activities. They can be stressful sometimes as time is limited and you need to fight for the bonus points (0.5 each, up to 3%). Tasks included block programming, typing HTML, presentations etc.

Professor speaks good English, and is nice and approachable. He is very laid back and tries really hard to make the lectures fun, so the atmosphere is usually quite good. He is also willing to answer questions after class. However, he doesn't really teach much during class and sometimes rushes through the lecture activities, without ensuring that most of the class has grasped the concepts. For example, during lecture activities, since only one person needs to complete the activity for the whole group to get a bonus, he only focused on the person who completed the task while most of the groupmates had to catch up on their own. His teaching style isn't really the best you can ask for, but he is very clear when he teaches in class or in videos so that's already decent for me.

The lab TA doesn't teach especially well but he isn't bad either. He manages to deliver most of the content he needs to and it is not hard for people to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
Most people say it is a good grade course. I'm not sure about that, but I can say that the grading feels quite fair.

This course is one of the less transparent ones I've taken. The professor hasn't provided any sort of statistics on the mean or SD of the project or the exams. The statistics of the MC part of the exam, labs and online quizzes can be seen from Canvas, but they are not of much significance.

Grading:
Exam: 30%
Project: 40%
Lecture activities: 10%
Quizzes: 10%
Labs: 10%

Online quizzes are often very easy and most people get 0.4-0.5 (out of 0.5) every time. They can't really differentiate the students. It is easy to get full marks for labs as long as you bother to bring your work to the lab for the TA to check. If you let him check in person, and he finds out that you made mistakes, you can change it at the lab until you get full marks. If you're confident you can do it perfectly at home (from my experience, most people find it easy to follow the tasks), you can submit your work via Canvas and you don't even need to show up to the lab.

The exam is conducted in the lab, and consists of two parts: MC and practical. I personally found the exam MC quite easy (I studied for a day before the exam). There were 40 questions and according to Canvas the max score is 39. Practical is a bit hard, you get to choose 2 from 4 questions (GIMP photo editing, Word, Excel, Powerpoint). I chose Word and Powerpoint because I found them the easiest. The difficulty of the Excel question was a bit ridiculous in my opinion. Time limit was 2 hours for both parts together, a bit tight.

Project grade is mainly made up of technical score and aesthetic scores. For technical scores, you get them as long as you complete that task. For aesthetics, you really need to work hard and see what the professor likes because he really cares about aesthetics lol

Didn't really study hard, but I had to make sure I completed all the components and tried to complete a decent project. I got 38/40 for exam MC, 6.95/7 for labs, full for quizzes and attendance plus 3% bonus. Others unknown. Finally got an A+. I think in this course hard work usually pays off.

reviews.author: I.048S96
reviews.title: Not a Very Helpful Course. But It May be Interesting.
reviews.comment_content:
Content, I believe is quite interesting. I wouldn't say it is entirely useful and valuable. It focuses on the general knowledge related to computers. But it does not help with any other computer courses you will probably take in HKUST (programming courses).

You do spend some hours doing Scratch, but because the content is not dealt in exams, most people do not have the opportunity to learn/understand basic programming. But otherwise, you will be given an opportunity to learn Excel, powerpoint, word, video editing, photoshop etc...
reviews.comment_teaching:
Not a common type of teaching/lecture style. You are required to watch video lectures outside of class, take a quiz and do lecture activities during the lectures.

The quizzes are not entirely easy. Some questions are quite challenging and vague so sometimes you need to get lucky.

The lecture activities are to give extra credits for the final score. However, most students get the full 3 points, so the bonus points do not help you a lot getting a higher letter grade.

The video lectures just read the powerpoint material... so yeah the teaching I wouldn't give full credit for.
reviews.comment_grading:
The professor does not provide the final scores, so I don't know what the average score is and what my project score is. I prefer grading to be transparent but some reason most of the scores (over 50% are done at the end of the semester and students don't have access to them).

I don't think the grading is lenient. The quizzes are not easy to get 100%, the final exam is not easy (Excel part especially).
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload, only when you have the project and when you have to study for the final exams, there's a lot of work to do. However, the exam takes place earlier than other exams --> you have more time to study for other exams.

If you are looking for a programming course, this is not the course to take. But if you need to take a COMP course and are not confident taking another COMP course, I guess this is the only option you have.
